description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8l8ub","text":"This work evaluates the life-time of the structural-switching aptamer sensors in the whole blood using in vitro blood circulation setup as the first step toward implantable usage. The device consists of a 3-electrode sensing probe with the tip of the working electrode (WE) functionalized with the antibiotics aptamers. Square-wave voltammetry (SWV) is used to continuously track both the signal peak and the background current at 5 sec temporal resolution. The sensing probe features a diameter of 800um and is inserted through a 18G catheter. Two samples of whole blood (EDTA treated), spiked with either 500uM kanamycin or SSC 1x (salin sodium citrate) buffer, are alternated toward the sensor to evaluate the degradation of the aptamer sensivitiy and the degree of drift.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s6ag","text":"Use heat-shrink and bare gold wire (250 um) to define the sensing area at the wire tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"511hv","text":"Solvent clean with sonication in acetone, methanol, and DI-water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"70ct0","text":"Perform electrochemical cleaning using 3-wire electrochemical system ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"95ejl","text":"a. 3 CV cycles in 200mM EC4 H2SO4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"699de","text":"b. 3 CV cycles in 50mM EC3 H2SO4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cupj5","text":"CV parameters: -0.4V ~ 1.5V, step = 0.001V, rate = 0.001V/sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

The sensing probe, with the tip functionalized with aptamer sensors, is inserted into the tube through a 18G catheter. The exposed wires are connected to the potentiostat for electrochemical sensing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2ja.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2ia.png","width":255.046875}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C5D465F019BF11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","height":null,"id":"34572","is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2hjrh","text":"Figure 2: Snapshot of the blood circulation loop setup in the lab.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2pa.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2na.png","width":254.046875}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aoa1n","text":"Human whole blood sample ( , stored at  upon receiving) is split into two separate reservoir, each with  . In the first reservoir,  of 5mM kanamycin in SSC buffer is added. The final concentration is therefore 500uM. In the second reservoir, 0.5mL of SSC buffer without kanamycin is added. Each reservoir has two opening for connecting to the two ports of the circulation loop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":104,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":131,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"15mqd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9vsf4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4n40t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cafin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9","guid":"80C0CB3019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","id":0,"label":"","step_guid":"58AB1B0019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8377119019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","id":0,"label":"","step_guid":"58AB1B0019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4.5","guid":"8E46671019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","id":0,"label":"","step_guid":"58AB1B0019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","unit":2}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","guid":"93CDF5E019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","id":0,"label":"","step_guid":"58AB1B0019BE11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7s0sk","text":"Insert the sensing probe and connect to the electronics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89tml","text":"PalmSense software is used to perform square-wave voltammetry (SWV) continuously. The parameters are listed below. Two SWV sweeps are performed sequentially at two different frequencies. The results are subtracted to mitigate the drift.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f2jal","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1c7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8l1d1","text":"Parameters are aptamer-specific, i.e. different aptamers will need different sweeping parameters for minimum drift.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94s02","text":"After each sweep, the measured current is stored in .CSV file. The results are post-processed in Matlab to extract: (1) background current, and (2) signal current, as shown in Figure 3. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fgv1g","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"56pcg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ED77301019BF11E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","height":null,"id":"34576","is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9jre","text":"Figure3. Example of SWV sweep. The signal of interest is the difference between the peak and the background (or baseline) current.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2ta.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2sa.png","width":424}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58l2n","text":"After 30-min stabilization period, the two samples are alternated using valves. Due to difference in the antibiotics concentration, the measurements resemble a square wave. The rise and fall time indicates the achievable temporal resolution, which is currently governed by the diffusion rate of the target across the porous membrane. Figure 4 shows an example of the measured results","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1kjo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"23kt6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7ilvv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"16D4F0A019C011E99A3EAD6D1BB8FB55","height":null,"id":"34580","is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"gfq2","text":"Figure 4: Measured time-domain results.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2xa.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/bb2wa.png","width":277.046875}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82oie","text":"Prepare 100 micromolar stock of kanamycin aptamer (5'-HS-(CH2)6-GGGACTTGGTTTAGGTAATGAGTCCC-(CH2)7-NH-MB-3â€™). Aptamer is functionalized with a thiol and methylene blue on the 5' and 3' termini respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3fpj2","text":"The aptamer-immobilized sensing probe will be approximately 6 ~ 10 cm in length and ~1mm in diameter in order to fit into the 18G catheter. The sensing probe consists of 3 wires: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eo4qa","text":"(1)  A working electrode (WE) made of a gold wire (Au, Alfa Aesar Inc.) with its tip functionalized with aptamers at approximately 2 mm in length, as defined by the heat shrink tubing (McMaster Carr Inc.). The diameter of the gold wire is approximately 250um. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4h651","text":"(2)  A reference electrode (RE) made of silver chloride (AgCl, A-M Systems) with a diameter approximately 100 um (by immersing silver wires in bleach overnight). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f3uf6","text":"(3)  A counter electrode (CE) made of platinum (Pt, A-M Systems). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5l73g","text":"Prepare fresh TCEP solution at a concentration of 28.7 mg/mL in water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
